question: Which country houses the "Seine River"?
explanation: The Seine River is a 775-kilometer long river and an important commercial waterway within the Paris Basin in the north of France. This river rises from the Langres plateau and then flows through Paris before finally drains at the English Channel of the Atlantic Ocean. The recreational boating of this river offers sightseeing of Notre-Dame, the Eiffel Tower, Louvre Museum, etc.
